author: sky.cactus
content: I wonder if we could have the block size increase when blocks are full, but *also* update gas_premium such that it is a function of block size or uncle rate instead of a flat value.

author: sky.cactus
content: In theory, miners should be okay with basically any size block as long as the gas premium increases proportionately to the block size.  By giving miners a way to have their gas premium be a function of block size, we could have block size auto-scale (with the addition of 1559).

author: sky.cactus
content: That *should* result in end-users deciding how big blocks are by way of asserting how much they are willing to pay to get included.

author: sky.cactus
content: Right now, for example, we see blocks full of ~30x the premium required by miners for 10M gas blocks, yet block sizes are remaining constant, likely due to miners not having dynamic block sizing algorithms in their clients.

author: sky.cactus
content: ðŸ¤” I suppose this could all be implemented client side.  We could just remove the block size limit entirely and update clients such that they only fill blocks until the gas premium received for any additional transactions isn't worth the increased uncle risk...
